history.text: Mean Girls, Personally I've never seen this movie (as far as I remember). But I believe is pretty much a cult movie in pop culture. Right?
Hi, let's get started. This is an interesting movie.
It was a top teen comedy and had a pretty decent cast.
Hey! Have you seen it? Ok, the movie is basically about highschool drama (social live)
Is it really accurate to wwhat you would see on an American HS?
Highschool, not American Horror Story lol
I have seen it but it has been years. rachel mcadams is one of my favorite actresses.
tina fey is such a great writer, no wonder it had so much success.
Yeah, I just learned that she was the writer! She's amazing
What did you liked about the movie?
i usually refer to rotten tomatoes whenever i want to see a movie, i had no idea that this one was rated so high.

i think it is still rele
vant due the clique that sill occur, not only in school but everyday life.
due you rely only on Rotten tomatoes?
how do you decide what movie to watch?
im surprised to learn it was released in 2004, it doesnt seem like it was that long ago that it was released
Geez, right, still really relevant... You see memes/gifs of that movie all the time
i get my initial opinion from trailers, but if i unsure i will read reviews
ha, yeah i still do see memes from time to time.
im pretty sure one of my friends dropped a quote the other day
which was it/
but at the end, do they end up as friends (Cady and Regina)
im trying to remember, like i said it had been awhile since i last saw it
its definitely worth a watch if you have some free time
i think it comes on network cable a lot
I bet, I have to watch it. Probably I'll finally get some jokes
it might be lindsay lohan's best (not saying much)
Really?
I still remember in that twin movie
Mathletes? lol, that's funny.. What even is that?
she makes amends with the other girls by the end of the film
its like an academic competition team
They were just jelous to her for being new/pretty girl I bet

thats what high school is all about right(sarcastically)
? trying to be popular and liked.
haha true, pretty much everywhere
I'm not from the US, but still applies
the burn book was pretty weird. i wonder if girls really did that.
Still, with this movies (and college movies - american pie lilke) they always push it to far and that's the perception that everyone has about the US
That's absolutely possible
the girls in the movie definitely were mean to each other.
So they were true to the title
But I bet the only mean one was regina
the other just followed here
would you watch the movie now, given the info that we learned?
what intrigued you the most about it?
I would
did your school expereince relate to theirs?
probably on a saturday evening while doing something else.
what type of movies du you ususally go for'

I've seen those. I usually don't care about a specific genre
just if I like it or not (trailer)
lacey chabert had a pretty forgetful career, but was good in this one
